content.description: Open book gully.  Harder than it looks...
content.location: Right of the Royal Arch Wall

content.description: This is a slab route that looks much easier from the ground.  The book Vertical Heartland has it listed as a 5.7, so I kept the rating.  It felt closer to a 5.9 to me.
content.location: The route is the second bolted route to the right of the Trad route Peter's lead.

content.description: Interesting moves through the first three bolts and then a little run out to the fourth bolt.
content.location: Second line on the shelf.  Shares anchors with Arch Angel.

content.description: Slab route.
content.location: Just left of Tina's Soul Food Kitchen and just right of Pete's Lead.

content.description: The hardest trad line in the canyon. Climb the thin crack till it's turns into a wide crack then top out.
content.protection: A little spicy. The one bomber fixed nut has now broken.
content.location: Locate hunters arrow chimney and no dogs allowed and in between you have the raconteur. There is a broken fixed nut about 15 feet up.

content.protection: C4 Cam sizes .5 through 4. (4 is good at the crux but eliminates a solid fist jam)
content.location: Pete's Lead is to the left of Smidgin.  The start is a left tilting ramp leading to the crack.  Get down by using the anchors for Smidgin provided it is not being used, or if the party on Smidgin doesn't mind sharing.

content.description: Low crux to iron flakes at the top.
content.protection: 5 QD, sling for last flake, + anchors.
content.location: This is the first bolted route to the left of the dihedral left of Deetle Dumps.

content.description: Climb up and through a short overhang (fun!), past 2 bolts (crux at second bolt). After surmounting the bulge, scramble up a low 5th class crack system, with a maybe 5.8 mossy crux getting up to the anchor (Step left to share anchor with Ebee).
content.protection: 2 bolts, and a couple pieces of gear, although the gear section feels about 5.8. Shares 2 bolt anchor with Ebee.
content.location: Route immediately right of Ebee, look for the obvious crack/flake that starts above two bolts.

content.description: I thought this was a really great, very sustained technical climb. Epic shallow-stemming crux, sequential foot traverse. Small holds, but you don't have to pull super hard because the rock is vertical to less-than-vertical. Awesome. Climbs more like a Smith Rock 12a than most Jackson routes.
content.location: Immediately to the right of the obvious water groove feature of "The Vow."

content.description: Cool line with a low crux and the another small one after the last bolt.
content.location: This route is located 10 ft. right of Archangel.

content.description: Climb the bulging, three part roof network.
content.location: Directly right of No Dancers

content.description: Boulder up to a big ledge (currently the crux by a long shot because it is super mossy). Once there, enjoy fun, sequential and sometimes improbable technical climbing to the top. A good and varied route for sure.
content.location: To the right of "My Head is Broke," which is bolted all the way to the ground. This one has the first bolt above above the ledge you boulder onto.

content.description: This is a fun route especially on lead. The guide book says that it is a 5.10a but I would give it a 5.9 just because the main face is mostly slab with great stances and plenty of places to rest. Also I climbed this when the rock was wet inside the crack and it was still an easy climb for me. The crux is at the very top when you have to pull around and behind the prominent point.   The only bad thing about the route is that rope drag is almost unavoidable especially if you're setting a TR.
content.protection: This crack uses a range of different cam sizes. I used (2) #2, (1) #1, and (1) .75 BD Camalots along with a #1 metolius master cam and a .5 link cam. There are also two bolts at the top for anchors. no chains
content.location: This is the first large dihedral crack on the Royal Arch wall

content.description: Climb the crack
content.location: The crack system directly right of The Raconteur

content.description: This route is located 10 feet right of The Meanest Flower.
Climb up the red colored smear on the wall.
content.location: First sport route right of Kryptonite

content.description: The crux is the start of the route. This is a good litle route. A lot of fun moves can be found in the gully. You can stem, chimeny, or just smear your way up.
content.protection: Protect the route with small pro. There are chains at the top. The route can also easly be toproped.
content.location: The route is to the right of Tina's Soul Food Kitchen.

content.description: Climb the iron-plated line.
content.location: Far left route when standing atop the shelf.

content.description: Climb the not so easy start on Easy Gully. Gently reach right to clip the first bolt. Two back to back crux sections await you. Crank through the first and desperatly balance through the second.
content.location: Starts on easy gully and moves right. Attack the two challenging bulges above.

content.description: Direct start to Blood Beets. Pull hard through an initial boulder problem to a standing rest. Tackle a precision pockets section, then go straight into the coolest part of the route; 2 bulges of requiring some sort of wizardry to navigate. Ahhhhmazing!
content.location: Starts 10 feet right of Easy Gulley

content.description: Lower crux with fun moves all through the climb.  A little slabby and balancy as well.  Really fun moves pulling the roof at the end to clip anchors.
content.location: Last route that starts on the shelf.  Moves up through the positive slab and then traverses left to the anchors above the roof.

content.description:
After entering the canyon via the dogwalk keep right. Hike downhill and cross a small creek, then continue following the trail back uphill where it joins back up with the cliff line. One of the first predominant features you will notice is a large detached boulder. This is the Yosemite Slab, continue past it to reach the Royal Arches Wall. Begin looking for the route Tina's Soul Food Kitchen in an easy to spot gulley as pictured here               

Tina’s Soul Food Kitchen      . Once you find this, the rest of the routes continue to your left.

 This sector has a good concentration of routes and will tend to be busy on crowded weekends.
